episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including Kaiser Wilhelm's unusual behavior, the unintended consequences of pickpocket warning signs, the pronunciation mystery of Louis Armstrong's name, and the extraordinary vocal abilities of a man with the lowest voice on record.

facts.fact: Kaiser Wilhelm once lost a valuable arms contract for Germany because he slapped the King of Bulgaria on the bottom.
Beware of pickpockets signs attract pickpockets.
No one is quite sure how to say the name Louis Armstrong, or Louis Armstrong.
The man who holds the Guinness World Record for the lowest voice can hit notes that are so low, only elephants can hear them.
